message: Wikipedia article on R: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R_(programming_language) ... then, download info at R's home: http://www.r-project.org -- and yes, it runs on major OS platforms.
Here's the STYLE guide used at Google to write R code: http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/google-r-style.html
Q: How can I use a loop to [...insert task here...]??? \\ A: Don't. Use one of the apply functions -- be sure to read: http://nsaunders.wordpress.com/2010/08/20/a-brief-introduction-to-apply-in-r/
sos :: Searching Help Pages of R Packages http://journal.r-project.org/archive/2009-2/RJournal_2009-2.pdf
HowTo load HUGE datasets into R : http://ff.im/zwMIo

fastest way to build a data frame: esp. useful for simulations, pre-allocate vectors separately, then fill in, finally combine those vectors into a data frame. The time savings is astonishing, see http://www.babelgraph.org/wp/?p=237
The intro to apply functions is interesting. Good to keep in mind that these themselves use R language loops underneath so that the benefits are conciseness and clarity rather than speed.
bigger picture... Overview on becoming a "Data Scientist" : http://www.quora.com/Educational-Resources/How-do-I-become-a-data-scientist/answers/89518# -- good pointers to related techniques.
